text: hi everyone it's Allen here today I will
be making a very simple yet editing
snack called monkey is of spicy fritter
made from cassava a perfecting of food
to bring to parties or just to snack on
during cold rainy days so let's begin
for this recipe you will need one
package of frozen grated cassava one
pound of 154 gram is also called manioc
tapioca or yuca is the root vegetable
that's originally looks like this you
can buy the frozen grated cassava in
package like this at Asian store or buy
the fresh cassava peel and soak in water
overnight then grate or cry in a food
processor into a paste like this we
gonna season it with pepper teaspoon of
salt 1tsp sugar and half a teaspoon of
chicken stock which is optional guy in
Vietnamese means hot or spicy so you
have to add chilies depending on how
spicy you can take just put one or two
teaspoon to give it a nice color we're
gonna add some turmeric powder about 1/2
to 2 teaspoons this is not a dessert
it's cat a savory snack but it's
vegetarian friendly also add about 3
tbsp of chopped spring onion and 2
tablespoon of all-purpose flour you can
also use rice flour or tapioca starch or
corn starch as well this is actually the
very flexible recipe you can freely
across the recipe to your taste you can
also add other ingredients like steamed
mung beans sweet khan's pepper
lemongrass curry powder or any other
spices that you like give it a good mix
so that all the ingredients combine
together well if it's too dry you can
add a little bit water just to make sure
that it's going to hold together
now heat the vegetable oil until you see
bubbles appear steadily around the
chopstick when the oil is hot enough
lower the heat to medium and start deep
frying then we're on gloves and pinch
about a teaspoon of the paste roll
between the bombs of your hands and
shape it into an oval shape gently drop
it into the hot oil and deep-fry until
it turns golden brown just continue the
process until you finish all the paste
you can fry many at a time just make
sure that they not too close to each
other to avoid sticking when they turn
golden brown remove from the oil and let
them rest on a rack or on paper towel to
drain off the excess oil arrange nicely
on a plate and it's ready to serve you
should make them in small size about the
size of your tongue or even smaller so
they will be more crispy if you make too
big it could be wrong inside let me give
it a try
mmm it's slightly crispy on the outside
a little chewy and glutinous on the
inside it's hot and of course spicy
otherwise is not called one guy right a
perfect snack for cold rainy day I hope
you like it too don't forget to thumbs
up and subscribe thank you for watching
